name: Coral Sea Waterworld Resort

reviews.text: My wife and I took our 3 boys (5, 4 and 18months) on Xmas Eve for 2 weeks. There were some positives and some negatives and we are comparing with first choice Turkey where we had a much better experience in May 2007.
reviews.title: Visited with small kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives
reviews.title: Good Hotel, shame about the weather!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kids den room was great - plenty of space and well laid out
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort itself is nice with its own beach, plenty of gardens and pools.
reviews.title: excellant hotel

reviews.text: The weather was mostly sunny but did get cold in the evening but we had checked ahead so knew it would so were OK.
reviews.title: excellen

likes.liked: — cleanleness, staff (really friendly) pools and rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Coral Beach for a week at the start of January. It was good value for money but not nearly as good as I was expecting. Having previously stayed at a four star First Choice hotel in Mexico on the beach I was expecting this to be similar, but Mexico was far superior.
reviews.title: Not as good as I was expecting but good value for money

likes.liked: — Located on the beach, jetty into the sea
likes.disliked: — Poor entertainment, very windy out of season

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked through First Choice and originally wanted to stay at the Conrad, but the travel agent had stayed at the Coral Beach and personally recommended it so we stayed there instead. I wish we had gone to Conrad.
reviews.title: lovely hotel

likes.liked: — the way they folded the towel to shape into hearts etc

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the most important things for me was to have some sun and spend the days relaxing by the pool or on the beach as we didn’t want to spend money on lots of excursions as it was meant to be a cheap week in the sun. It was in a good location for this, however there was such a strong wind every day it made it so cold – far too cold to even get in the pool. (Apparently the Conrad was in a little bay by the posh hotels and did not have this problem. It was also quite close to Naama Bay whereas the Coral Sea is about 12 miles away). There is a lovely jetty leading into the sea but it was so windy we could hardly get to the end of it – even the Russians were cold!
reviews.title: briliant hotel but rubbish entertainment

reviews.text: The room was lovely and big, large wardrobe, bathroom and balcony and always cleaned to a very high standard. The food was ok, always something to eat and plenty of choice although the Indian restaurant was not open during our stay and we had not been informed of this in advance. Lunch at the Mermaid bar was always lovely, but again so windy you had to be fully dressed! The drinks were local brand, but you could have as many drinks as you like and not feel obliged to tip unless you wish to. There was a football pitch offering classes for kids and a match every Sunday for the adults.
reviews.title: Bordering Average - Would not go again.

likes.disliked: — Jacuzzi Bath is a waste of money - did not work

reviews.title: First Choice Should Be Your Last Choice
reviews.text: Like everyone else says though, I was very disappointed in the entertainment. The reps try their best but it was like watching a load of school girls at a karaoke. The night starts with kids discos, then bingo then a quiz then the main entertainment – this is when the reps start “singing” and “dancing”. It was like one of those awful X factor auditions and was the most awful entertainment I have ever seen and I felt embarrassed for them. The first night I watched it I think my mouth was hanging open as I just couldn’t believe they were serious. Even worse – that was the “best of” clips for the rest of the week (it all went downhill after that). As it was too windy to sunbathe, got dark at 5pm then this was the entertainment, I was very disappointed and got very bored.

reviews.title: Good for a break
reviews.text: Have recently returned from a last minute break, booked throough first choice, must say that the airline is not great, the food was poor on the flight and the seats are small for anyone over 5'9". The hotel was as advertised in the brochure, makes a change. The room was spacious and clean although the bed was as hard as nails and gave us back ache by the end of the week. The welcome meeting was a bit of a dissappointment , all the reps wanted to do was sell the trips and did not realy give any good advise for those people visiting a muslim country for the first time, eg drinking the water, ice , topless bathing, religious issues. At the meeting first choice are in with a company called Lion who try to get you to go to a meeting selling future holidays, in return they will give you a £50 vouchure to be used against trips. We did this trip just to get the £50, basically its time share under another guise, they will try t o sell you cheap holidyas for 3 years and quote silly prices to lure you. There is a membership fee which they will not telll you until a lot later in the meeting. 2 hours or more. you only have to stay for an hour and a half to qualify. The rep was some wide boy from London. After 2 and a nhalf hours we said enough was enough and wrapped the meeting up. it was only then that they said that it would be £2800 for 3 years membership and the price of the holiday. They do try to give you a free holiday but you end up paying for that in the price The rep tried to price our previous holiday to New York last Oct, he promised us it would be at least 30% cheaper, when it came up on the computer it was more expensive. Dont go on this trip unless you want a free £50 towards trips.

reviews.title: First Choice Should be your last choice
reviews.text: Back to the hotel...... the food was good and plentiful, not brilliant but ok and edible. at the beginning of the week we were there it was a full smoking in the dine around restaurant but by the end it was all non smoking, not sure what was going on there but for us non smokers, pleasant relief. not much to do at the hotel or nearby by we did not plan on doing much. The big pool you see in the pictures is freezing , the other one is heated and ok, Its warmer in the sea.Most of the locals want English money pound coins are useful for tips etc.... The ATM in the foyer gives a good exchange rate , over 10 Egyption pounds to the £1 whereas 8 in UK. Staff very friendly and very pleasant. We would definatley go back for a break to this resort , but maybe not with First Choice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Coral Sea Resort in Sharm El Sheik is in the middle of no where and I mean it's been dumped in the middle of the desert with NOTHING in the surrounding area - the odd shop but no restaurants, bars or anything. So if you don't mind staying at the hotel for the entirety of your holiday then it's fine. Although you will get bored of eating exactly the same food every single day and sitting in the 'bar' aka the recetion area with absolutely no atmosphere. However it's a First Choice hotel and they should be sued under the trade descriptions act for saying the provide 'entertainment'. What they provide is a couple of frustrated karakoe singers who think that a lunch time quiz and a game of darts is an inventive way of entertaining holiday makers. The evening 'entertainment' is ten times worse. You get Stacey singing her favourite Dolly Parton tunes. I'd rather scratch my eyes out that have to listen to that again. Most of the staff in the hotel are fine but we ended up complaining about some of the men in the dining room for jeering and leering at us. Groups of women beware - really would not recommended Egypt because the harrasement is so bad. You get ripped off everywhere for everything - I had to see a doctor and get some tablets - it cost me £80.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a fantastic week, wasn't long enough. Booked a deluxe room where fast tracked to an amazing room, with VIP tickets. Staff really freindly, food was really good and NO dodgy tummy's. The Italian restaruant is a must brill food best we had. Pool bar was great and heated, just what you need at this time of year, got a fab tan could be windy which was a bit chilly at times and needed a cardy at night but weather was good. Namma Bay was great but did feel a bit intimidated at times in some of the shops, found shopping in the hotel much easier and got some great bargains and really freindly guys. Will be coming back again and to this hotel. Quad biking was a good day out , the scooters where cheap and you could ride along the beach snorkelling is fantastic, would have done more if we were there longer. Be careful though the mini bar in your room is not free 2 chocolate bars 2 bottles of beer and a can of pop £25 so be warned. Still that wasn't enough to spoil the holiday. Fab!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this resort after it was recommended by a friend and reading all the fab reviews on this site. Don't believe the bad ones, some people are never satisfied.
reviews.title: The truth

likes.disliked: — can't think of anything apart from First choice input was Dire

reviews.text: In our party : Myself and the Hubby are both 30 and we have 2 children 3 and 1 years old, we also traveled with my parent both in 50's (All Non Smokers) in 2 rooms
reviews.title: Great Value for Money, well worth a visit

likes.disliked: — No lifts & Smoking in resturants & bars

reviews.title: great time had by all
reviews.text: I'l keep it short and sweet and facts only

Our room was massive very clean and looked like it had just been painted as no marks on wall, the bathroom was not as good but still very nice. We stayed in room 1034 on the ground floor so had no balcony but a lovely patio which opened and looked out onto pool area and the beach and best of all when you lay on the bed you could see the Sea (bliss) We had a massive Kingsize bed and a travel cot for baby but no other bed for 3 year old, at 1st I thought the 3 seater would turn into a bed for her but couldn't find any bedding for it. I rang recepion explained and no lie we had a bed in 5 mins in our room.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Exceeded expectations

likes.liked: — Staff, cleanliness, proximity to the beach
likes.disliked: — Entertainment well meant but not to everyone's taste

reviews.title: loved this hotel
reviews.text: The food in restaurant was lovely I could not fault it, I'm not a fussy eater but a little picky so was worried. I'm always willing to try new food and love garlic, herbs & spices. The only thing I will say is if you only like English food and don't like garlic, herbs and spices don't go to Egypt full stop. They always had an English style meals but the veg always had herbs and garlic on. I did hear that some people in Hotel lived on chips and pizza (sad people) as they did not like the food.

reviews.title: Loved It, Loved it, Loved it!
reviews.text: The entertainment staff are all employed by First Choice so at least its catered to us brits, they do work hard the team in making sure everyone enjoyed holiday. Always plenty acctivities on during the day for adults and children. Evening enterainment was in Irish Bar we went for Kiddies disco and quiz sometimes stayed for bingo but the Smoke was so bad in Irish Bar I couldn't stay in to long.

aka: Coral Sea Hotel Sharm El Sheikh
description: When it's time to plan your next family vacation, choose the Coral Sea Waterworld beachfront all-inclusive resort and experience the newest water park in Nabq Bay, Sharm El Sheikh. Coral Sea Waterworld families are guaranteed to enjoy spending days on the body slides: twisting body slide, speed slides, tube and multi-lane slides. After the sun goes down, enjoy fine dining at the Indian restaurant, then laze around with friends over a drink at Finnley’s bar or perhaps feel the beats at the Hard Rock Café just around the corner. Make Coral Sea Waterworld your next Sharm El Sheikh getaway and experience utmost action!
